Understate: The claim may understate the issue of unsolved murders in the city of St. Louis by stating that only half of the murders get solved, implying that the other half are solved.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the statement that only half of the murders in St. Louis get solved.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the rate of solved murders is shocking or unexpected, without providing further context or comparison to other cities or regions.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors influencing the rate of solved murders in St. Louis that are not addressed in the claim.
